q:
Mike is the brother-in-law of John, who has two daughters but no son. Paul is the cousin of Bob and the brother of Mary. Smith has two daughters and one son. Lisa has only one son and one daughter. Mike is the only sibling of David. Tara and Anita are daughters of Ben. Jack is also a member of this family. Mary is the granddaughter of John, who is married to David. Lisa and Smith are sons-in-law of David.

How is David related to Jack?

A family of 10 members over three generations goes to a picnic. John is the father of Bob and has only one son. Mike is the son-in-law of Alice and the father of Ben. Paul is the uncle of Mary. Lisa is the aunt of Anita, who is the daughter of Tara. Tara is the daughter in law of John. Alice is the mother of Lisa who has two children. Each child has both of its parents alive.

Four of the following five are alike in a certain way and so form a group. Which is the one that does not belong to the group?

A family of 10 members over three generations goes to a picnic. John is the father of Bob and has only one son. Mike is the son-in-law of Alice and the father of Ben. Paul is the uncle of Mary. Lisa is the aunt of Anita, who is the daughter of Tara. Tara is the daughter in law of John. Alice is the mother of Lisa who has two children. Each child has both of its parents alive.

How many male members are there in the family?

Alice is the sister of Tara. Tara is married to Paul. Paul is the father of Mary. Mike is the son of Anita. Tara is the mother-in-law of  Anita. Paul has only one son and no daughter. Alice is married to Bob. Lisa is daughter of Bob. How is Lisa related to Tara?

Bob is the father of Paul. Bob has only two children. Paul is the brother of Tara. Tara is the daughter of Lisa. Alice is the granddaughter of Lisa. Ben is the father of Alice. How is Ben related to Paul?

Mike is the brother-in-law of John, who has two daughters but no son. Paul is the cousin of Bob and the brother of Mary. Smith has two daughters and one son. Lisa has only one son and one daughter. Mike is the only sibling of David. Tara and Anita are daughters of Ben. Jack is also a member of this family. Mary is the granddaughter of John, who is married to David. Lisa and Smith are sons-in-law of David.

Three of the following are alike in some way. Which of the following is the odd one out?

Mike is the brother-in-law of John, who has two daughters but no son. Paul is the cousin of Bob and the brother of Mary. Smith has two daughters and one son. Lisa has only one son and one daughter. Mike is the only sibling of David. Tara and Anita are daughters of Ben. Jack is also a member of this family. Mary is the granddaughter of John, who is married to David. Lisa and Smith are sons-in-law of David.

How is Ben related to Anita?

Eight persons – John, Lisa, Mike, Paul, Alice, Mary, David, and Tara consists of a family of three generations such that there are three females and two married couples in the family. For every person of the family, either both or none of the parents are alive.

  • Mike's sister-in-law is the mother of David
  • Tara is an unmarried female.
  • David's mother doesn't have any siblings.
  • John is the father in law of Mary who is the mother of two children.
  • Lisa is the grandmother of David who is nephew of Paul.

How is Mike related to Lisa?

Situation: When Alice, tops in her MBBS course, she becomes the 7th member of her family to join the Medical profession. All other family members namely John, Tara, Bob, Ben, Lisa, and Anita are working at a hospital as doctors and Alice who is the youngest of the third generation is all set to join them. In this family of three generations, there are two pairs of couples and two pairs of brothers and sisters. There are three Oncologists, two Dentists, one Physician, and one Neurologist in the family. No female in the family is an Oncologist. Anita is not a Neurologist. No married person in the family is a Dentist. John is the son of Tara while Ben is the son of Bob and Bob's wife is Anita. Bob is an Oncologist. Bob and Anita are the eldest couples in the family. Alice is the daughter of Ben while Lisa is the sister-in-law of Tara.

Problem: How is Bob related to John?

Mary's son Bob is married to Alice whose sister Anita is married to Jason who is the brother of Bob. How Anita is related to Mary?
While talking to Bob, Mike said, "I am the only son of one of the sons of his father." How is Bob related to Mike?
John told Bob,"This boy playing basketball is the younger of the two brothers of the daughter of my father's wife." How is the boy playing basketball related to John?
While introducing his friend Mike said, "He is the son of the daughter of the father of my uncle." How is the boy related to Mike?
John while explaining to Bob about his family commented about a boy that "He is the son of the only son of my mother." How is John related to that boy?
B is the father of Q. B has only two children. Q is the brother of R. R is the daughter of P. A is the granddaughter of P. S is the father of A. How is S related to Q?

Consider the information given below:

M % N means M is the mother of N
M / N means M is the son of N
M $ N means M is the wife of N
M + N means M is the father of N
M * N means M is the sister of N

Which among the following expressions is correct if the statement, "B is the son of A" is definitely false?

 

Expressions

  1. Q % A + S * B / O
     
  2. Q % O * S * B / A
     
  3. Q + O * S + B / A
     
  4. Q $ A + O + B + S

Based on the following information determine the relation between Q's mother and S's father:

  • P is S's father
  • F is P's sister
  • Q and P are brothers
  • L and B are Q and P's daughters respectively

a.option: Q's mother is S's father's aunt
Q's mother is S's father's mother
Q's mother is S's father's sister-in-law
Q's mother is S's father's cousin

q:
You are given the following information:

1. P $ Q means P is the brother of Q
2. P # Q means P is the mother of Q
3. P * Q means P is the daughter of Q

Which of the following relationships directly implies that D is a father?


Relationships

  1. A # B $ C * D
     
  2. B * A $ C # D
     
  3. C # B * A $ D

You are given the following information.

- Alan is equivalent to Son
- Ron is equivalent to Father
- Bob is equivalent to Mother
- Abe is equivalent to Daughter
- Paul is equivalent to Wife

If the below given information is true then how is R related to X?

1. R is Alan of M
2. X is Abe of N
3. N is Paul of M

Consider the given information and answer how is A related to T:

  • A is the son of B's father's sister
  • H is N's father and A's grandfather
  • P is T's son
  • T is V's mother, B's grandmother and H's wife

A family has 9 members in it—M, N, O, K, J, G, I, Y, and X. Based on the following information, determine how many family members are female:

  • K is O's son and is married to G
  • J is G's sister
  • Y is K's father O's daughter and she is married to N's son I
  • J is both M and X's aunt
  • I have no children

X, Y, and Z meet their relatives, M, N, O, and P while visiting the zoo. Based on the following information, determine how is P related to X:

  1. O is M and N's only son
  2. X is Y's brother and Z is X's father
  3. N P's brother-in-law and Y's father-in-law
  4. There are 7 people in total

Based on the following information. determine which of the following expressions concludes that A is C's daughter:

X + Y means X is Y's father
X % Y means X is Y's mother

X $ Y means X is Y's wife
X * Y means X is Y's sister
X / Y means X is Y's son

Pointing to a man in an old photograph, Bob said, "His father's sister is the only daughter of my father's mother".
How is the man's father related to Bob?

Consider the following information:

A + B means A is the mother of B.
A – B means A is the brother B.
A % B means A is the father of B
A * B means A is the sister of B.

Now, which of the following statements is correct with respect to the given information?

Statements:

  1. P + Q * R – S means P is the maternal uncle of S
     
  2. P – Q + R * S means P is the maternal uncle of S
     
  3. S – Q % P means P is the maternal uncle of S
     
  4. S – Q + R * P means P is the maternal uncle of S

Pointing to a girl in a photograph, Bob said, "I have no son or daughter, but that girl's sister is my father's daughter."
Who was the person in the photograph?

There are six people M, N, O, P, Q, and R in a family. Their professions are psychologist, manager, lawyer, jeweller, doctor, and engineer.

Based on the given information, determine the profession of Q:

  1. The doctor is R's grandfather who is a psychologist
  2. Manager P is married to M
  3. O, the jeweller is married to the Lawyer
  4.  N is Q and R's mother
  5. There are two married couples in the family.

Consider the information given below:

P, Q, R, S, T, and U are six members of a family.

1. T is the daughter of S, who is not the father of T.
2. Q is the sister of S.
3. U and S are a married couple.
4. R is the son of U, who is the brother of P.

Now, from the given information, determine the number of males in the family:

You are given the following information:

- 1 is equivalent to Son
- 2 is equivalent to Father
- 3 is equivalent to Mother
- 4 is equivalent to Daughter
- 5 is equivalent to Wife

Now, consider the information given below:

- Bob is 1 of Ben
- Alice is 4 of Mary
- Mary is 5 of Ben

Based on the information given above, how is Bob related to Mary?

Consider the following information:

  • X is the brother of Y
  • Y is the sister of Z
  • Z is the father of A


Based on the given information how is A related to X?

Based on the given information, answer how is N related to E:

  1. There is a family where, D and E are married couples and they have only two children, L and M.
  2. N and L are married couples and they have two daughters A and F.
  3. B is G's wife and L's mother-in-law.
  4. E is C's grandmother and J's daughter.
  5. N is Q's sister

Consider the information following information to determine how many children Amy has:

  1. Uriel is Shane's brother.
  2. Taylor is Amy's daughter.
  3. Victor is Rick's brother.
  4. Rick is Shane's son but Shane is not Rick's mother.
  5. Amy and Shane are married to each other.

Six executives of a private limited company namely, U, V, W, X, Y, and Z are playing cricket. Based on the following information, determine how many executives are male:


1. U and Y are brothers and Z is Y's sister
2. W is U's uncle's only son
3. V and X are daughters of W's father's brother
4. U and V are not siblings.

Consider the following information:

- Ben is 2 Bob
- Alice is 4 Mary
- Bob is 3 Alice

where,
2 represents ' Son of '
3 represents ' Father of'
4 represents ' Daughter of'

Based on the given information, which of the following relationships is correct?

You are given the following information:

  • A is the brother of E.
  • M is the daughter of A and also the sister of Q.
  • T is the mother of Q.
  • V is the father of T.
  • P, who is the son of H is the brother of T.
  • D has only one son and is married to K, who is the mother of A.

Now based on the given information, how is P related to Q?

A, B, and C visit their relatives, Q, R, S, and T for summer vacation. Based on the given information, determine who is the spouse of S:

  • S is the only son of Q and R
  • A is B's brother and C is A's father
  • R is T's brother-in-law and B's father-in-law
  • There are only 7 people in total

You are given the following:
1. 0 - 1 means, 0 is the brother of 1
2. 0 / 1 means, 0 is the son of 1
3. 0 * 1 means, 0 is the mother of 1
4. 0 + 1 means, 0 is the sister of 1


If you have the expression A + B - C * D / E, then which of the following is false?

You are given the following information:

  • 1 Represents Father
  • 2 Represents Mother
  • 5 Represents Son
  • 10 Represents Wife
  • 17 Represents Daughter
     


and a function F(N) = N*N+1, 
where N can be any whole number


Now, consider the information given below:

  • Bob is F(2) of Ben
  • Mary is F(1) of Anita
  • Anita is F(4) of Ben
     

What is the relationship between Anita and Bob based on the information given above?

Consider the information given below. Now based on the given information, determine the relationship between A and Y.


1. X is the son of A
2. X is the brother of Y
3. Z is the sister of Y
4. Z is the daughter of A

a.option: Y is the son of A
Y is the daughter of A
Y is the brother of A

q:
Six members of a family Q, R, S, T, U, and V are enjoying a vacation. Read the below relations carefully and determine which of the following is a pair of females:

  1. U is S's brother
  2. T is Q's daughter
  3. V is R's brother
  4. R is S's son but S is not R's mother
  5. Q and S are married to each other

Consider the following information:

Six colleagues of an office namely, M, Q, O, R, N, and S are playing cricket.
1. M and Y are brothers and S is the sister of N.
2. O is the only son of M's uncle.
3. Q and R are the daughters of the brother of O's father.
4. M and Q are not siblings.

Now, how many of these colleagues are real brothers?

In a family, R and U are a married couple and they have only two children, H and L. Z and H are a married couple and they have two daughters, A and F. B is the wife of G and mother in law of H. U is the grandmother of C, who is the daughter of J. Z is the sister of Q.
How is F related to J?

You are given the following information:

  • Alice is the grandmother of Bob
  • Bob is the daughter of Ben
  • Mike is the father of Ben

Now, based on the given information what is the relationship between Mike and Alice?
